entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Fees of Messengers-at-Arms) 2013
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt substitutes a new Table of Fees for the Table of Fees in Schedule1 to the Act of Sederunt (Fees of Messengers-at-Arms) (No.2) 2002.

title.div: The School Admission Appeals Code (Appointed Day) (Wales) Order 2013 / Gorchymyn y Cod Apelau Derbyn Ysgol (Diwrnod Penodedig) (Cymru) 2013

div.p: This Order appoints 1 January 2014 as the day on which the School Admission Appeals Code (“the Appeals Code”) issued under sections 84 and 85 of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (“the SSFA 1998”) by the Welsh Ministers comes into force. The Appeals Code applies in relation to Wales.

Mae’r Gorchymyn hwn yn pennu 1 Ionawr 2014 fel y diwrnod y daw’r Cod Apelau Derbyn Ysgol (“y Cod Apelau”) a ddyroddwyd gan Weinidogion Cymru o dan adrannau 84 a 85 o Ddeddf Safonau a Fframwaith Ysgolion 1998 (“DSFfY 1998”) i rym. Mae’r Cod Apelau yn gymwys o ran Cymru.

title.div: The Welsh Language (Wales) Measure 2011 (Commencement No.7) Order 2013 / Gorchymyn Mesur y Gymraeg (Cymru) 2011 (Cychwyn Rhif 7) 2013

div.p: This Order is made under section 156(2) of the Welsh Language (Wales) Measure 2011 (“the Measure”). It brings into force provisions of the Measure that relate to the Welsh Language Tribunal to enable the Welsh Ministers to appoint the members of the Tribunal and for the President to start preparatory work. The provisions are within Part 7 of, and Schedule 11 to, the Measure.

Gwneir y Gorchymyn hwn o dan adran 156(2) o Fesur y Gymraeg (Cymru) 2011 (“y Mesur”). Mae’n dwyn i rym ddarpariaethau’r Mesur sy’n ymwneud â Thribiwnlys y Gymraeg er mwyn galluogi Gweinidogion Cymru i benodi aelodau’r Tribiwnlys ac i’r Llywydd ddechrau’r gwaith paratoadol. Mae’r darpariaethau o fewn Rhan 7 o’r Mesur ac Atodlen 11 iddo.

entry.title: The Post-16 Education (Scotland) Act 2013 (Commencement No. 2) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order brings into force the following provisions of the Post-16 Education (Scotland) Act 2013 (“the Act”) on 13th January 2014: sections 5(1); 18; 20; 21 and paragraphs 2(1) and (2)(b) and 8(1) and (23)(a)(i), (iii) and (iv) of the schedule to the Act.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Fees of Sheriff Officers) 2013
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt substitutes a new Table of Fees for the Table of Fees in Schedule 1 to the Act of Sederunt (Fees of Sheriff Officers) (No.2) 2002, by substituting a new Table of Fees.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Variation of Areas of Health Boards) (Scotland) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order varies the areas of Scotland for which Health Boards are constituted to the extent necessary to align the boundaries of Health Board areas and local authority areas.

title.div: The Welsh Language Tribunal (Appointment) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Tribiwnlys y Gymraeg (Penodi) 2013

div.p: The Welsh Language (Wales) Measure 2011 (“the Measure”) establishes a Welsh Language Tribunal (“the Tribunal”). The Tribunal will comprise of a President, legally qualified members and lay members. Section 120 of the Measure provides that the Welsh Ministers appoint the members of the Tribunal.

Mae Mesur y Gymraeg (Cymru) 2011 (“y Mesur”) yn sefydlu Tribiwnlys y Gymraeg (“y Tribiwnlys”). Bydd y Tribiwnlys wedi’i ffurfio o Lywydd, aelodau wedi ymgymhwyso yn y gyfraith ac aelodau lleyg. Mae adran 120 o’r Mesur yn darparu mai Gweinidogion Cymru sy’n penodi aelodau’r Tribiwnlys.

title.div: The Housing Renewal Grants (Amendment) (Wales) (No. 2) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Grantiau Adnewyddu Tai (Diwygio) (Cymru) (Rhif 2) 2013

div.p: These Regulations make consequential amendments to the Housing Renewal Grants Regulations 1996 to deal with the impact of armed forces independence payment on means testing for receipt of disabled facilities grants.

Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn gwneud diwygiadau canlyniadol i Reoliadau Grantiau Adnewyddu Tai 1996 er mwyn ymdrin ag effaith taliad annibyniaeth y lluoedd arfog ar y profion modd ar gyfer derbyn grantiau cyfleusterau i’r anabl.

title.div: The Education (Information About Individual Pupils) (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2013 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Gwybodaeth am Ddisgyblion Unigol) (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2013

div.p: These Regulations amend the Education (Information About Individual Pupils) (Wales) Regulations 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”). The 2007 Regulations require the governing body of any maintained school on receiving a written request from the local authority by which the school is maintained to supply within fourteen days such of the information as is requested by the authority in respect of pupils at the school.

Mae’r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Addysg (Gwybodaeth am Ddisgyblion Unigol) (Cymru) 2007 (“Rheoliadau 2007”). Mae Rheoliadau 2007 yn ei gwneud yn ofynnol i gorff llywodraethu unrhyw ysgol a gynhelir, pan fydd cais ysgrifenedig yn dod i law oddi wrth yr awdurdod lleol sy’n cynnal yr ysgol, gyflenwi, o fewn pedwar diwrnod ar ddeg, unrhyw wybodaeth y bydd yr awdurdod yn gofyn amdani mewn cysylltiad â disgyblion yn yr ysgol.

entry.title: The Smoke Control Areas (Exempted Fireplaces) (No. 2) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Smoke Control Areas (Exempted Fireplaces) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2013 (S.R. 2013 No. 198), and subsequently re-instate the provisions.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Qualifying EU Provisions) (No. 2) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order specifies the following EU legislation as qualifying EU provisions for the purposes of various provisions of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (c. 8) (“FSMA”):

entry.title: The Legal Aid for Crown Court Proceedings (Costs) (Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Legal Aid for Crown Court Proceedings (Costs) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2005, which prescribe the Crown Court remuneration for solicitors and counsel assigned under Articles 29 or 36(2) of the Legal Aid, Advice and Assistance (Northern Ireland) Order 1981.

entry.title: The Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (Consumer Credit) (Transitional Provisions) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order is made under section 426 of the Financial Services and Markets Act 2000 (c.8) (the “2000 Act”).

entry.title: The Education (Fees and Student Support) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Student Support) Regulations 2011 (S.I. 2011/1986) (“the Student Support Regulations”), the Higher Education (Basic Amount) (England) Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/3021) (“the Basic Amount Regulations”) and the Higher Education (Higher Amount) (England) Regulations 2010 (S.I. 2010/3020) (“the Higher Amount Regulations”).

entry.title: The Food Safety, Food Hygiene and Official Controls (Sprouting Seeds and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the General Food Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004 (S.R. 2004 No. 505) (regulation 2), the Food Hygiene Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006 (S.R. 2006 No. 13) (regulation 3) and the Official Feed and Food Controls Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009 (S.R. 2009 No. 427) (regulation 4) in order to provide for the enforcement of the following EU Regulations –

entry.title: The Postal Services (Universal Postal Service) (Amendment) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order amends the Postal Services (Universal Postal Service) Order 2012 (S.I. 2012/936)(the “principal Order”).

entry.title: The Capital Requirements (Country-by-Country Reporting) Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Article 89 of the Directive 2013/36/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 June 2013 on access to the activity of credit institutions and the prudential supervision of credit institutions and investment firms, amending Directive 2002/87/EC and repealing Directives 2006/48/EC and 2006/49/EC (OJ no L176, 27/6/2013, p. 338; for corrigenda see OJ no L208, 2/8/2013, p.73).

entry.title: The Feed (Hygiene and Enforcement) and the Animal Feed (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2013
The Capital Requirements Regulations 2013
entry.summary: These Regulations implement in part a package of EU legislation known as “CRD4”. CRD4 is concerned with the authorisation of credit institutions and the prudential rules applicable to credit institutions and investment firms.

entry.title: The Transfer of Functions Concerning School Lunches etc. (England) (Amendment) Order 2013
entry.summary: This Order amends the Education (Transfer of Functions Concerning School Lunches etc.) (England) (No. 2) Order 1999 so as to provide that the duty to provide school lunches in accordance with section 512(3) and (4) of the Education Act 1996, and the duty to provide school lunches free of charge in accordance with section 512ZB(1) of that Act, is transferred from local authorities to the governing body of each maintained school in England, irrespective of whether the school’s budget share includes a specific amount in respect of meals and other refreshment.
